特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
IMPORTANT NOTICE:

This course is conducted in lecture format. Please note the following in light of the ongoing pandemic.
1. For all students: assignments will be posted on LUNA daily, along with important announcements about the course, and so it is critical that students log in to LUNA regularly during this course.
2. Some lectures may be posted online in lieu of face to face lectures (the URL will be provided on LUNA).

トピック.授業外学習2:
Additional information provided in the detailed syllabus that will be given to students on the first day of class.

This is an intensive format: 14 weeks of course work condensed into one week. This means that students will have several hours of homework for each of this course's five days.

Final Paper is Due on Wednesday, March 1st at 5:00 PM.

評価.教科書Required texts0:
1. The Globalization of World Politics,” by John Baylis, Steve Smith, and Patricia Owens,  (Oxford University Press, 2020).* 
This book is available at the university bookstore, on Amazon, and a copy is also being held on reserve at the SIS library (second floor of the G-IS Building). Note: Students who are not able to access this book in person on campus or unable to purchase this book can instead go to the Amazon Japan website and check the free sample of this book to complete the reading assignments.

2. de Soete, Francois, "The Trump Presidency, the Coronavirus, and the New America: Can the U.S. Military Still Preserve the Status Quo in East Asia?" (The Journal of International Studies, 2021) - Available on this course's LUNA page.

3. 2. de Soete, Francois, "Trump, Biden, and U.S. Foreign Policy: Analyzing the Role of the Modern Presidency on America's Standing in the World" (The Journal of International Studies, 2022) - Available on this course's LUNA page.
評価.参考文献・資料Reference books0: Books for this course will be held on reserve at the library. The book titles will be provided in the detailed syllabus given to students on the first day of class.
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
https://kwic.kwansei.ac.jp/cabinet/reference?typeCd=0&cabinetId=557&directLink=1
※kwicへのリンクとなります（在学生のみ閲覧可）
成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: Final paper or In-Class Final Examination
成績評価Grading2: Weekly short assignments based on the lectures and In-Class Participation
評価.備考Note0:
IMPORTANT NOTICE:

This course is conducted in lecture format. Please note the following in light of the ongoing pandemic.
1. Attendance is not taken in this course. The lectures that are held in person are also available live on Zoom.
2. Assignments will be posted on LUNA daily, along with important announcements about the course, and so it is critical that students log in to LUNA regularly during this course.
3. Some lectures may be posted online in lieu of face to face lectures (the URL will be provided on LUNA) -- information about any lecture to be posted online instead of face to face will be announced on LUNA.

Lecture Schedule

Day 1 - Mon. Feb 20 (3rd, 4th, 5th Period).        -- Format: In-Person / Face-to-Face in the Classroom (lectures are also live on Zoom)

Day 2 - Tues. Feb 21 (3rd, 4th, 5th Period).        -- Format: Online Only (Lectures Uploaded on YouTube)

Day 3 - Wed. Feb 22 (3rd, 4th, 5th Period)         -- Format: In- Person / Face-to-Face in the Classroom (lectures are also live on Zoom)

Day 4 - Fri.    Feb 24 (3rd, 4th, 5th Period)         -- Format: Online Only (Lectures Uploaded on YouTube)

Day 5 - Sat.   Feb 25 (3rd, 4th Period).                -- Format: In- Person / Face-to-Face in the Classroom (lectures are also live on Zoom)

Final Paper is Due on Wednesday, March 1st at 9:00 a.m.
